bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from S. W. Welch to Laura Armistead Carter, January 8, 1926

div1.p: Welch writes Carter about his friendship with and admiration for Henry Rose Carter.

div1.head: Letter from S. W. Welch to Laura Armistead Carter, January 8, 1926
div1.opener:
ALABAMA
HERE WE REST
GREAT SEAL.
STATE OF ALABAMA
ALABAMA STATE BOARD OF HEALTH
519 DEXTER AVENUE
MONTGOMERY
BUREAUS
I
VITAL STATISTICS
HYGIENIC LABORATORY
ENGINEERING
COUNTY ORGANIZATION
VENEREAL DISEASE CONTROL
CHILD HYGIENE AND PUBLIC
HEALTH NURSING
EPIDEMIOLOGY
INSPECTION
PUBLICITY, EDUCATION AND
PRINTING
TUBERCULOSIS CONTROL
January 8, 1926.
Miss Laura Carter,
c/o Surgeon General H. S. Cumming,
United States Public Health Service,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Miss Laura:
div1.p:
The letter I wrote you some months ago
failed to find its way. I am embarrassed that my words of
appreciation of your distinguished father did not reach you.
I cannot be content until I have told you that I valued his
friendship more than I did any man's with whom I was ever as-
sociated. He was to my mind one of the truly great men of the
world; Such a man as we could wish could live always. I want
you to know that I appreciate your friendship, and would like
to be of service to Dr. Carter's dauther, if the time ever
came when I could help.

I am sending this letter in care of Surgeon-
General H. S. Cumming since I balled up your address the other
time.

With great admiration, I am with best wishes
for a Happy New Year,
div1.closer:
Respectfully, S. W. Welch S. W. Welch, M. D.,
State Health Officer.
